DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to observe the incidence of nausea with systemic chemotherapy that includes consecutive days (more than one day)of cisplatin medication.
DOC.brief_title: Nausea and Vomiting In Patients Receiving Consecutive Days of Cisplatin
DOC.detailed_description: Questionnaires are completed on week of chemotherapy treatment referred to as Dartmouth regimen.
DOC.criteria: confirmed diagnosis metastatic melanoma 18 years and older undergoing chemotherapy with Dartmouth regimen medically stable to receive chemotherapy per physical and clinical laboratory tests No medical conditions that interfere with assessment of nausea and vomiting during chemotherapy No cognitive disorder that impairs symptom assessment No other investigational agent Inability to swallow medications for nausea and vomiting No gastric outlet obstruction
